newsitem.title: USA: Legato says confident on 1997 estimates.
newsitem.headline: Legato says confident on 1997 estimates.

text.p: Legato Systems Inc said it remains confident it can meet analysts' estimates for 1997 earnings despite posting first quarter earnings per share which were one penny below consensus.
"We said we were confident with the projections that are still there," Ed Cooper, corporate director of strategic communications at Palo Alto-based Legato, said.

Shares of Legato tumbled 4-5/8 to 12 as market sources cited concerns over product mix and a product transition to lower price products for network storage and backup for Microsoft Corp's Windows NT system from Unix.
Market sources said some investors were concerned about Legato's ability to execute its product transition plans in the near-term and about increased competition.

One market source said he expects the company to feel greater competitive pressure at the high end from Veritas Software Corp.'s newly acquired Open Vision Technologies Inc. Veritas, which reported a 67 percent jump in first quarter revenues after the market close on Wednesday, rose 3-3/8 to 30.
But Cooper said there had been no change to its competitive environment. "We really don't compete in the same exact market segment," he said of Open Vision.

"We took a near-term blip on the radar screen for longer-term gain," he said of the company's strategy of shifting into the rapidly growing Windows NT marketplace. ((sam.perry@reuters.com, Palo Alto Bureau 415 846 5400))
